feed.title: SAP Community - ABAP Cloud
feed.subtitle: ABAP Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP ABAP Developer for Custom Module Development
entry.content: Looking for an SAP technical consultant to develop custom business logic and integration components for our ERP implementation. Need assistance with ABAP programming for custom reports and data extraction routines, workflow configuration and approval process automation, user exit and enhancement implementation for standard SAP transactions, interface development using IDocs and RFC connections for third-party system integration, custom transaction creation with screen design and validation logic, and performance optimization for existing ABAP programs and database queries. Requirements include strong ABAP programming skills with SAP development workbench experience, knowledge of SAP module integration (FI/CO, MM, SD) and business process workflows, understanding of SAP transport management and change request procedures, experience with debugging tools and performance analysis techniques. Timeline: 1-2 days, remote SAP system access required.

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud - Adobe Forms: Extend data source and layout
entry.content:
Hello,

I have some questions about forms in S4 Public Cloud. I hope you can help clarify my thoughts.

First, I wanted to know if there is a way to extend the data source of a form without having to create customer fields. My customer's requirement is to print data on the form that isn't in the data source. For example, to print data from the related delivery or the intercompany purchase order on the sales order. Therefore, I don't need to create custom fields; this information is already in SAP. I need to extend the data source and dynamically populate this extension with the necessary information. I don't want to create new customer fields in the database.

Another requirement from my customer is to group sales order items by material group. That is, they don't want to print items 10, 20, 30, etc. They want to group by the material group field and first print a header (Material Group 1) and below it all the items in that material group. Then they'll print another header (Material Group 2) and the items in that material group... In S4 Private, I would have developed this type of logic in the print/BADI program, form context, or form interface. But in S4 Public, I don't have any of these options. Can the data source be extended and a completely customized data structure developed by me be added? Are these types of groupings developed directly with Javascript in the Adobe form?

Kind Regards.

entry.title: MDG replication of field not successful
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I am newbie in Webservices and need some second opinions from you guys.

My Business Analyst told me that the field KNA1-RPMKR should be copied from source system to target system. We use the transaction DRFOUT to perform this.

No errors were found in SRT_MONI and DRFOUT as well.

Unfortunately, the field does not get copied even though it has a value in the source system.

The question is, should I ask for help from SAP since this standard class CL_MDG_BP_RPLCTRQ and standard method BP_SUITEBULK_REPL_REQ_IN also in SPROXY the service definition is SAP standard BusinessPartnerSUITEBulkReplic?

If not, then what will be my next step?

Please help.

Newguy_cloud

entry.title: API "Billing Document - Read, Cancel, GetPDF" : how to consume in ABAP Cloud ?
entry.content:
Dear All,

Requirement : in S/4HANA Public Cloud, reading Header Texts from a Billing Document, in ABAP Cloud

To fulfill this requirement, the CDS entity "I_BillingDocumentTextTP" cannot be used, as it does not return the LongText.

Therefore, I want to consume the API "API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV" in ABAP Cloud.

I'm following the steps as described in https://api.sap.com/api/API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV/cloud-sdk/ABAP

--> Generating Proxies for Remote OData Service.

I have created a Service Consumption Model :

I have copied the code of the Entity Set A_BillingDocumentText into my class, and I have added the input parameters for the method "cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_comm_arrangement"

 

 DATA:
      ls_entity_key    TYPE z_scm_api_billing_document_srv=>tys_a_billing_document_text_ty,
      ls_business_data TYPE z_scm_api_billing_document_srv=>tys_a_billing_document_text_ty,
      lo_http_client   TYPE REF TO if_web_http_client,
      lo_resource      TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_cp_resource_entity,
      lo_client_proxy  TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_cp_client_proxy,
      lo_request       TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_cp_request_read,
      lo_response      TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_cp_response_read.

    TRY.
        " Create http client
        TRY.
            DATA(lo_destination) = cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_comm_arrangement(
                                                         comm_scenario  = 'SAP_COM_0120'
                                                         comm_system_id = 'CPI'
                                                         service_id     = 'BD_CONFIRMATION_OUT_SPRX'
                                                         ).
          CATCH cx_http_dest_provider_error INTO DATA(cx_http_dest_provider_error).
            RAISE SHORTDUMP cx_http_dest_provider_error.
        ENDTRY.

        lo_http_client = cl_web_http_client_manager=>create_by_http_destination( lo_destination ).
        lo_client_proxy = /iwbep/cl_cp_factory_remote=>create_v2_remote_proxy(
          EXPORTING
             is_proxy_model_key       = VALUE #( repository_id       = 'DEFAULT'
                                                 proxy_model_id      = 'Z_SCM_API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV'
                                                 proxy_model_version = '0001' )
            io_http_client             = lo_http_client
            iv_relative_service_root   = '/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV/' ).

        ASSERT lo_http_client IS BOUND.


        " Set entity key
        ls_entity_key = VALUE #(
                  billing_document  = '0090000122'
                  language          = 'E'
                  long_text_id      = 'TX06' ).

        " Navigate to the resource
        lo_resource = lo_client_proxy->create_resource_for_entity_set( 'A_BILLING_DOCUMENT_TEXT' )->navigate_with_key( ls_entity_key ).

        " Execute the request and retrieve the business data
        lo_response = lo_resource->create_request_for_read( )->execute( ).
        lo_response->get_business_data( IMPORTING es_business_data = ls_business_data ).

      CATCH /iwbep/cx_cp_remote INTO DATA(lx_remote).
        " Handle remote Exception
        " It contains details about the problems of your http(s) connection

      CATCH /iwbep/cx_gateway INTO DATA(lx_gateway).
        " Handle Exception

      CATCH cx_web_http_client_error INTO DATA(lx_web_http_client_error).
        " Handle Exception
        RAISE SHORTDUMP lx_web_http_client_error.


    ENDTRY.

 

The Communication Arrangement is as follows :

 

When I run the code, an exception is raised by the method cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_comm_arrangement: 

Error :
{O:353*\CLASS=CX_HTTP_DEST_PROVIDER_ERROR} Internal error [CM_HTTP_DEST_PROV(004)] CL_HTTP_DESTINATION_PROVIDER [Line:265]

 

The raise location is :

 

What can be the reason for this raised exception ?

 

Many thanks

 

Hans Segers

entry.title: Modify the BKPF-WWERT field of the accounting entry in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system.
entry.content:
Hello Experts, good afternoon.

I need to modify the “Conversion date” field. / BKPF-WWERT"  from the accounting entry through a BADI, EXIT, Replacement, Custom Logic, or any other tool in the system SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - ABAP CLOUD. However, I haven't been able to find a way to modify it.

Please, is there any way to modify that value in the FI accounting entry?

 

On the other hand, in the SAP OnPremise version, it was possible to modify it and there were options available. However, in SAP S/4 Cloud, there do not appear to be any options.

 

I look forward to any suggestions or support.

Thank you very much.

@ABAPCloud_Developer 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 

ABAP Extensibility 

ABAP Cloud 

FIN (Finance) 

Best regards,

entry.title: RAP ABAP Runtime Error – CONVT_NO_NUMBER
entry.content:
Dear All,

While working in the RAP application, we are encountering the following ABAP runtime error: 'CONVERT_NO_NUMBER'.
This occurs when entering a value in the Attach ID field.

It appears the system is attempting to convert a non-numeric value into a numeric type, which is causing the issue. Kindly look into the data type handling or conversion logic in the relevant field or binding.

Your support in resolving this issue is appreciated.

 

 

but my field data type is char32. so please help.

entry.title: Need infomation on text from notes tab , process receivables
entry.content:
Hi 

I am not able to find table where these notes are saved .

I tried in SOOD and STXH tables . No entry exist .

I also need where the sticky notes text are saved . 

I have to pull these all text into a report . 

 

Please help,

Bharti

entry.title: Any API or EML for posting with clearing for vendor transfer?
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I really hope that your knowledge help me with this problem.

Currently I need to create a program that allows to transfer posting with clearing in Cloud Public. This process was cover in On-Premise system by the FB05 transaction and its respectives BAPIS.

But now I tried to do the process with the API JournalEntryBulkClearingRequest_In (API Reference | Journal Entry - Clearing (Asynchronous) | SAP Business Accelerator Hub) but is not possible because it required to indicate the bill and the payment, in this case I only has the bill.

I tried with EML but the entity I_JOURNALENTRYTP doesn't have the clearing scenario.

entry.title: Update the status to “Sent to bank” in the Monitor Payments application - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Experts, good afternoon.

We are currently implementing scope item 2YM for the automatic payment process. This API allows integration with CPI so that the file can then be sent to the bank. Likewise, the payment formats used are customized Z formats due to the requirement.

On the other hand, the SAP BCM solution is not being used in its entirety due to cost issues.

API Implemented

My question is as follows:

- How do I update the following statuses: “Sent to Bank,” “Completed” in the following application?

- Is there a BADI, Custom Logic, API, or missing configuration that allows me to update the statuses?

Thank you very much.

I look forward to any support and/or recommendations.

Best regards,

entry.title: Fiori Flexible Workflow for Purchase Orders - My inbox is empty
entry.content:
Hello everyone

During upgrade from on prem 2020 to 2023 (I think) there are some problems with Flexible Workflow. User cannot see any WF items in his Inbox Fiorii App. He has to go to SBWP and then accept the PO.

Normally it works that users ( approvers ) have to receive notification in theirs Inbox.  They only receive email notification about approve.

I will be appreciated for any support.

entry.content:

entry.title: Issue connecting custom form to MES | "Form is a legacy form and cannot be used with this API"
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m currently working with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and we’re facing an issue when trying to connect a form (in this case, a custom one, but we also tested with standard forms) to a custom plant control system (MES system).

When triggering the process, we get the following error message:

“Form: YY1_PP_ETIQUETAFABRICACION is a legacy form and cannot be used with this API.”

see attached screenshot for details:

Stardard FormCustom Form

 

 

 

 

We would like to understand:

  • Are we possibly using the wrong API for this scenario?

  • Is there a way to adapt or convert the form type so that it can be used?

  • Is this limitation expected for forms of this kind in Public Cloud?

Any insights, documentation links, or experiences with similar cases would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your help!

Best regards,

ASG.

#S4HANACloud #SAPPublicCloud #SAPForms #ABAPCloud #SAPIntegration #SAPAPI #MESIntegration #SAPBTP #BusinessTechnologyPlatform #FormsService #S4HANA #SAPCommunity

entry.title: 🤬 SAP Public Cloud: It's not a Bug, it's a feature not yet localized
entry.content:
Recently, SAP Support has started using a new phrase... "It's not a Bug, it's a feature not yet localized for xxx Country"

2 different instances that I faced recently:

  • RAP BO: I_BILLINGDOCUMENTTP Action CreateFromExternalData
    • Issue: Dump happens during Save phase
    • Reason: For Brazil, there are some mandatory field checks coded within the Billing Document Save that throws Messages, which RAP engine doesn't like, and thus results in a BEHAVIOR_ILLEGAL_STATEMENT dump.
    • Response: ......The localization of the 1Z6 scope item was carried out using the API with SOAP, and this process does not involve the I_BillingDocumentTP Business Object.....
  • RAP BO: I_PURCHASEORDERTP_2 Action Create
    • Issue: Delivery Address passed in the RAP BO by calling program, isn't considered for Tax calculation
    • Reason: The bug is identified in Class CL_TXS_FM_ADDRESS, method GET_ADDRESS_COMPLETE. The class is passing both address number & address handle to the function module ADDR_GET_COMPLETE, and this results in a Parameter_error Exception. The exception is happening because both parameters contain value. If address handle is populated, then only address handle must be passed to the function. If address handle is not populated, only then pass the address number. This requires a simple fix. A simple IF condition before the Function module call will avoid the Parameter_Error exception.
    • Response: ....However, since you are using a Z class for the creation of the Purchase Order, we cannot guarantee that the process will work properly, as the document creation flow is different. This also happens when using some Fiori Apps, such as Manage Purchase Order, for example....... I would like to emphasize that this is not a SAP bug, but rather a scenario that is not localized for Brazil, since in these contexts we are directly consuming an MM Core logic. If you use the localized VH Create Purchase Order - Advanced (ME21N), you won't face any issues.......

It is incredibly painful to get together enough people to vote on a request for a new API on Influence portal, since everyone who are working with Public Cloud, may not face the same requirement at the same exact time. And, until they face the issue, they may not bother to come to Influence portal and search for the request and vote on it. Even if we do all that, and gather enough votes and gather SAP's attention to put in a development request for the API, what I hear now is released APIs are still not to be trusted, because they may not be localized for a specific country or a specific scenario and it takes another Influence ticket in Localization Influence Portal, and the same chain of processes, for it to become useful.

What does released API even mean? Where on API hub is the documentation/list of localized APIs?

entry.title: Currency/Quantity Reference in CDS view
entry.content:
Hi,

I am trying to create a CDS view on top of the table /SAPAPO/MATLWH.

This table has a field RSQTY with unit reference to T006-MSEHI.

Now my issue is, in DDIC table the reference table needs no join to the main table. But in CDS view I am unable to use the reference Unit in "@Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure without bringing it thru an ASSOCIATION first.

And, in this case there's no common field between /SAPAPO/MATLWH and T006 using which I can define an association.

I am no CDS expert. Am I doing something wrong?

@AndreaUS - I went thru your blog but couldn't figure out a solution. Can you please help?

#ABAP #CDS

entry.title: Combining MATID and MATNR field in CDS/AMDP
entry.content:
Here’s a more polished and professional version of your message:

Hello Team,

We have a requirement to join the /SCWM/AQUA and MARA tables using the MATNR field. We're currently working on building a CDS report for this purpose. However, due to the conversion exit involved, it seems this cannot be achieved through the standard approach—at least to the best of my knowledge.

I’ve also tried implementing this using AMDP, but it seems that handling the conversion exit is not feasible there either. Given our requirement, we cannot use virtual elements, which leaves us with only two viable options: either proceed with AMDP or perform the join directly within the CDS view.

Has anyone come across a solution or workaround for this scenarios?

entry.title: Clean Core level c sql update query on eket
entry.content:
Hello,

currently we are make our product clean core level c ready. To do that, we have to eliminate some old update queries on some tables. The tables are eket, konm and konp . To get to level c, we are not allowed to do these operations directly on the data base instead i was told that we should use the view i_purordschedulelineapi01 .  When I try to use the query on this view, my IDE is telling me "Änderungsoperation auf dieser Entität sind noch nicht unterstützt". (on english "changing operations on this entity are not available yet") . Does anybody know an alternative (something like a badi or another view) that i can use? Furthermore the view is not tagged as writeable.

The same goes for the other data bases konm and konp. The successors are I_SlsPrcgCndnRecordScale and I_SlsPrcgConditionRecord. This views are also not writeable and ill get the same error message.

Thanks for any help in advance

entry.title: I am getting a blank page when I preview my RAP service binding in the BTP trial account.
entry.content:
TITLE:
UCON 403 Forbidden Error - "The request has been blocked by UCON" on OData Service

DESCRIPTION:
I am experiencing a 403 Forbidden error when trying to access an OData service through a Fiori application. The error message in the browser console states:

"The request has been blocked by UCON."

DETAILS:
- Error Code: 403 Forbidden
- Error Message: "The request has been blocked by UCON"
- Application URL: https://[your-system-url]/sap/bc/adt/businessservices/odatav2/feap/[service-details]/flp.html
- SAP Client: 100
- Language: EN
- Resource Endpoint: /sap/opu/odata/sap/Z[service-name]

ERROR DETAILS FROM BROWSER CONSOLE:
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 403 (Forbidden)
/sap/opu/odata/sap/Z…e&sap-language=EN:1

 

I am trying to display a list view by creating an entity on this service definition, and I have also created a service binding for it. 

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'demo'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
    serviceQuality: #X,
    sizeCategory: #S,
    dataClass: #MIXED
}
define view entity Zsam_demo as select from /dmo/connection
{
@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 10 ,label: 'CarrierId' }]
    key carrier_id as CarrierId,
@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 20 ,label: 'ConnectionId' }]
    key connection_id as ConnectionId,
    @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 30 ,label: 'AirportFromId' }]
    airport_from_id as AirportFromId,
    @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 40 ,label: 'AirportToId' }]
    airport_to_id as AirportToId,
    @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 50 ,label: 'DepartureTime' }]
    departure_time as DepartureTime, 
    @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 60 ,label: 'ArrivalTime' }]
    arrival_time as ArrivalTime
}
@EndUserText.label: 'demo'
define service Zssd_sam_demo {
  expose Zsam_demo;
}

 

Please let me know anyone know to how resolve the issue 

I tried everything — I even deleted my BTP instance and created a new one, but I’m still facing the same issue.

entry.title: How to Add a New Tab in ESS Portal for Time Event (Punch In/Out)
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I am working on Employee Self-Service (ESS) in SAP Portal and I want to add a new tab in the ESS overview for Time Event, where employees can view and record Punch In / Punch Out times.

Here’s what I have done so far:

  1. Created a Web Dynpro ABAP Component (Z_HRESS_TIME_EVENT) with:

    • From Date / To Date input

    • Punch In / Punch Out buttons

    • Table showing history of time events

  2. Exposed it as a Web Dynpro Application (Z_HRESS_TIME_EVENT_APP) in SE80, which runs perfectly when tested directly.

  3. In LPD_CUST, I created a new folder under the same Role / Instance as other tabs (Working Time, Personal Information, Benefits) and added my application there.

Problem / Question:

When I log in to the ESS Portal, I do not see my new tab. I understand that the Portal shows tabs via iViews and role assignments.

I want to know:

  • How can I create an iView for my Web Dynpro application and assign it to the ESS Role / Workset in the Portal?

  • Can this be done without Portal Admin access, or do I need someone with admin rights?

  • Are there best practices for adding Time Event tabs in ESS overview for punch in/out functionality?

Any guidance, example steps, or references would be very helpful!

Thanks in advance.

#SAP #ABAP #WebDynpro #ESS #SAPPortal #EmployeeSelfService #LPD_CUST #FPM

entry.title: BAdI Sorter in SAP BTP ABAP for custom BAdI Definition
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Recently we've been developing solutions in SAP BTP ABAP environment, and we would like to create some custom Business Add-in (BAdI) and hook its BAdI definition inside our code for customer extension.

It looks good so far, until we came with a question, how to define the sequence for these BAdIs implementation?

In On-Premise world, we used the good old BADI_SORTER but seems like it isn't permitted to use in BTP ABAP environment. Even if it's allowed, I think it is still using the classic elements like dynpro screen, function modules, ... which isn't following the modern strategy from SAP when developing in cloud environment like BTP ABAP.

I've been exploring a bit on the Internet as well as SAP published documentations for SAP BTP ABAP. Unfortunately, I couldn't find any other options to enable sorting of custom BAdI implementations.

Does anyone have any ideas, how to control the sequence of BAdIs in BTP ABAP?

Thank you very much.

Best Regards,

Tan
